author: Wpedm
title: Forced content
content:
Snapchat used to be a simple app ‚Äî just friends sending pictures and messages back and forth. That‚Äôs all it needed to be. But now? It feels like it‚Äôs turned into a circus of unwanted, low-quality content shoved in your face at every turn. The ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù section is the worst offender. It‚Äôs flooded with clickbait headlines, trashy tabloid stories, and cheap, recycled internet nonsense that nobody actually asked for. Half of it looks like it was designed to prey on teenagers‚Äô insecurities or just stir up drama. And let‚Äôs be real: who opens Snapchat because they want to scroll through bottom-of-the-barrel internet articles? No one. Yet the app forces it on us.

Then there‚Äôs ‚ÄúSpotlight.‚Äù It‚Äôs basically TikTok‚Äôs annoying little brother, full of random, low-effort videos from strangers that have nothing to do with you or your friends. The content quality is abysmal ‚Äî mostly repetitive trends, people trying way too hard to go viral, or flat-out cringe clips that you‚Äôd never waste your time on if you had the choice. But Snapchat doesn‚Äôt care. It just keeps pumping it at you, as if it‚Äôs doing you some kind of favor.

And now, they‚Äôve crossed another line: ads in our chat boxes. Let that sink in ‚Äî we can‚Äôt even have private conversations with friends without corporations wedging themselves right into the middle of it. It‚Äôs invasive, desperate, and honestly insulting. Your chat screen is supposed to be personal, but Snapchat decided that selling your attention is more important than respecting your space.

The whole app feels less like a social platform and more like a giant billboard disguised as a messaging service. What was once about genuine connections has turned into an aggressive content dump where ads, clickbait, and mindless videos take center stage, while the actual reason we downloaded the app ‚Äî talking to our friends ‚Äî gets buried.

It‚Äôs frustrating, it‚Äôs exhausting, and it‚Äôs unnecessary. Snapchat has stopped listening to its users and instead turned into yet another platform more interested in shoving garbage in your face than actually providing value. It‚Äôs a shame, because it could be a great app. Instead, it feels like you have to wade through a swamp of junk just to use it for its original purpose. And honestly? I‚Äôm tired of it.

author: MsSandieJo
title: Dropped tw-FOUR stars‚Ä¶
content:
Let‚Äôs see how this played out. 

I loved this app. 

I even FINALLY got access to the Live feature that I plan to share my artwork/woodworking. 

Unfortunately, after the 2024 election, TikTok apparently decided that our First Amendment rights are no longer valid. What‚Äôs not allowed? The word ‚Äúrigged‚Äù? I‚Äôm polite, respectful, and thoughtful with my words and intentions‚Äîbut suddenly the PRESIDENT is a taboo subject‚ÄîESPECIALLY if the comments are not in FAVOR of the current fascist administration?

We have supported TikTok‚Äîespecially since they tried to ban this app‚Äîand THIS is how we‚Äôre thanked?! By stifling OUR rights?!

I have said NOTHING non factual, albeit not supportive of this administration, yet when people say things that are false, misleading, or plainly abhorrent towards the TikTok community and humanity‚Äîit‚Äôs NOT removed???

How can we feel comfortable with interacting in the app, if we get strikes for the MOST ridiculous reasons‚Äîand others are able to say the most outrageous things? It‚Äôs not just me‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs actually videos discussing this issue. 

Please do better TikTok. We need you behind us now, more than ever.

author: Marsha üöÄ
title: love this app but..
content:
I wanted to share some feedback about the new drafts section layout. Right now, it shows the filter name instead of the audio name. This makes it really difficult to manage my drafts because most of mine use the same filter, so I can‚Äôt tell which draft is which unless I open and play the video.

The old version was much easier to use because it showed the audio name at the bottom, which helped me instantly recognize the exact draft I wanted to post. If a video doesn‚Äôt have a filter, it still shows the audio name, so I think it would make sense for videos with filters to also display the audio instead. The filter is less important in identifying the draft compared to the audio.

It would be great if the drafts section could go back to the original format where the audio name is always visible. That way, it‚Äôs much easier and more practical to organize and choose drafts to post.

Thank you for considering this!

author: BRADDACOOLAIDMAN
title: Your Local Narrator
content:
Are you someone with $10‚Äì14 to spare? Perfect, because Spotify is basically like renting every jukebox in the world at once. For the price of two fancy coffees or one suspiciously large gas station burrito, you can stream every song you‚Äôve ever loved, plus 10 million you‚Äôll skip after 3 seconds.

The algorithm? Oh, it knows me. It knows I want sad breakup songs when I haven‚Äôt even been in a relationship since the Obama administration. It knows I want Viking battle chants at 2 a.m. on a Wednesday. It even knows that my guilty pleasure is early 2000s pop punk‚Ä¶ and it won‚Äôt let me forget it.

Spotify Premium is like being rich in music but broke in real life. Ads disappear, downloads appear, and suddenly you‚Äôre the kind of person who thinks, ‚ÄúYeah, I do need a playlist called ‚ÄòSongs for Pretending I‚Äôm in a Movie Trailer.

10/10 would recommend. Except to my wallet, which is currently crying in the corner.

author: ParadoxicallyThinking
title: Great streaming service with some flaws.
content: I love Spotify, I‚Äôve used it for years. It‚Äôs most known for being free so long as you‚Äôre okay with missing out on some features, and having to deal with ads. It is objectively better than Apple Music mostly because you are given much more freedom and control over your playback, such as; Crossfade, Customizable EQ, full control over volume levels, full control over audio quality on both cellular and wifi connections, and more recently custom mixing where you can specialize specific songs with their own exclusive EQ and details, whether than having every song you listen to be locked to one setting. My biggest issue with this app is how easy it is to accidentally swipe and skip a song. I find myself constantly accidentally switching between songs when trying to swipe down to get the media player out of the way. Despite its few flaw, Spotify has always been a staple brand for anyone looking to simply stream music, as long as you aren‚Äôt really nerdy, -like me- and you don‚Äôt care about statistics like audio quality, or EQ stuff, this app will be great for you. But even if you do care about the nerdy stuff I‚Äôd still recommend it. Mostly because you aren‚Äôt going to find another one that gives you as much freedom as Spotify does. So it essentially comes down to what you‚Äôre looking for in a streaming platform.
